title: POMPE
content:
POMPE was the goddess or spirit (daimona) of religious processions or, more specifically, of the
        phallic, fertility processions of the god Dionysos.

Pompe does not occur in any extant literature but in the Athenian vase-painting (right) she and Dionysos gaze
        at each other affectionately in the company of Eros (Love).

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
